snippet: Spokesmen for the vigilante groups said they would not give up their weapons until the government arrested the top leaders of a drug ring that controls part of Michoacán State.
abstract: Mexican soldiers meet fierce resistance as they begin disarming vigilante groups that have been fighting drug gangs in western state of Michoacan; groups say they are defending their villages and families; refuse to surrender weapons until government arrests top leaders of Knights Templar drug ring.

byline.original: By ELISABETH MALKIN and PAULINA VILLEGAS

lead_paragraph: Spokesmen for the vigilante groups said they would not give up their weapons until the government arrested the top leaders of a drug ring that controls part of Michoacán State.

headline.main: Mexico Faces Obstacle in Curbing Vigilantes Fighting Drug Gang
headline.print_headline: Mexico Faces Obstacle in Curbing Vigilantes Fighting Drug Gang
